questionText: The layer of the scalp that containing the epicranial aponeurosis is.
The layer of the scalp that containing muscles is.
The following nerve is supplying the skin of the back of the scalp (behind the auricle):
Regarding the temporalis muscle, one of the following is true.
options: It originates from the zygomatic arch.
It is inserted into the coronoid process of the mandible.

questionText: One of the following muscles is not inserted into the mandible.
Which of the following muscles can protrude the mandible to opposite side.
Regarding the masseter muscle, one of the following is true.
options: Its deep muscle fibers are oblique.
It is supplied by the facial nerve.
Its superficial fibers can protrude the mandible.
Its superficial muscle fibers are vertical.

questionText: A man developed a paralysis of the facial nerve, what muscle will continue to function despite this affection.
Regarding the temporomandibular joint, one of the following is true.
options: It is a hinge joint only
It allows both rotation and gliding movements
It is formed by the condyle of the fibula

questionText: Regarding the medial pterygoid muscle, one of the following is false.
options: It is a powerful elevator of the mandible
It forms the medial wall of the infratemporal fossa
It originates from the lateral pterygoid plate
It inserts into the lateral surface of the mandibular ramus

questionText: One of the following is a branch from the facial nerve:
Which of the following muscles has a dual nerve supply?
Protrusion of the tongue is brought out by:
The sensory nerve supply to the skin overlying the angle of the mandible is by the:
options: Buccal branch of mandibular division of the trigeminal nerve

questionText: Where does the temporalis muscle inserts:
For sternocleidomastoid, which is true:
options: Contraction of one muscle rotate the face to the same side
It is crossed superficially by the external jugular vein
It is supplied by the transverse cervical nerve
It is superficial to the deep cervical fascia

questionText: The lower lip gets its sensory nerve supply through the:
Which of the following cranial nerves carries the pain sensation from the tip of tongue:
Tensor palate muscle is innervated by:
The capsule of the temporomandibular joint supplied by the following nerve:
The auriculotemporal nerve supplies the following area:
options: Outer layer of the ear drum and capsule of the temporomandibular joint.
Lining mucosa of the middle ear and inner layer of ear drum.
Skin of the anterior part of the temple.
Skin of the dorsum of the nose and lower eye lid.

questionText: Regarding the medial pterygoid muscle, which of the following is true?
options: It is supplied by the facial nerve
It originates from the lateral surface of the lateral pterygoid plate

questionText: Which of the following statements about the buccinator muscle is FALSE?
options: It is a muscle of facial expression
It is supplied by the buccal branch of the facial nerve
It forms the muscular basis of the cheek
It is pierced by the parotid duct

questionText: The infraorbital nerve supplies all of the following EXCEPT:
